titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I read through Charles's very interesting "Drew Lecture" on "Immortality". It is extremely suggestive & stimulating. Then I wrote to the "'Times" on "The Athanasian Creed".

p.hi: During the afternoon I received a telegram from the Bishop's Chaplain announcing the death of Archdeacon Price. I ordered the cathedral bell to be tolled after service.

The Suffragettes apparently have renewed their policy of indiscriminating outrages with special application to churches. I thought well to order the closing of the doors leading to the Banks, the Cloisters, & the Crypt.
